sec.p:
The DPPH method is an simple, rapid, valid accurate and sensitive approach to evaluate the antioxidant activity of a special composition or plant extracts.
32 Especially, EO of T.minuta (DPPH=66.23±0.92%, IC 50=29.31±0.8 µg/ml) has more antioxidant potential than its methanolic extracts (DPPH=36.21±1.44%, IC 50=48.67±0.8 µg/ml) ( Table 4). This antioxidant activity is in line with those of previous studies with I C50 between 35-344 μg/ml.
19 Thus, the study suggests that these fractions (The methanol extract and the volatile oil) are good sources of antioxidant compounds. However, the extraction techniques and time of extraction can highly affect the results of DPPH assay.
33

div.div: Content of phenolic compounds in essential oil ( A) and methanolic extract ( B) of T.minuta
